intro: Dalibarda latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf lousewort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a distinctive appearance with small, pink or purple flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are broad and often have a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in its preferred habitat.
